00034 /*
00035  * $Log$
00036  * Revision 1.9  2009/02/06 15:37:39  haraldkipp
00037  * Added stack space multiplier and addend. Adjusted stack space.
00038  *
00039  * Revision 1.8  2008/08/28 11:12:15  haraldkipp
00040  * Added interface flags, which will be required to implement Ethernet ioctl
00041  * functions.
00042  *
00043  * Revision 1.7  2008/08/11 06:59:17  haraldkipp
00044  * BSD types replaced by stdint types (feature request #1282721).
00045  *
00046  * Revision 1.6  2007/05/02 11:22:51  haraldkipp
00047  * Added multicast table entry.
00048  *
00049  * Revision 1.5  2006/10/08 16:48:08  haraldkipp
00050  * Documentation fixed
00051  *
00052  * Revision 1.4  2006/06/28 14:30:19  haraldkipp
00053  * Post to the event queue on overflow interrupts.
00054  * Transmit event queue removed, because no one is listening.
00055  *
00056  * Revision 1.3  2005/10/24 18:02:34  haraldkipp
00057  * Fixes for ATmega103.
00058  *
00059  * Revision 1.2  2005/08/02 17:46:45  haraldkipp
00060  * Major API documentation update.
00061  *
00062  * Revision 1.1  2005/07/26 18:02:40  haraldkipp
00063  * Moved from dev.
00064  *
00065  * Revision 1.13  2005/04/30 16:42:41  chaac
00066  * Fixed bug in handling of NUTDEBUG. Added include for cfg/os.h. If NUTDEBUG
00067  * is defined in NutConf, it will make effect where it is used.
00068  *
00069  * Revision 1.12  2005/02/02 19:55:34  haraldkipp
00070  * If no Ethernet link was available on the LAN91C111, each outgoing packet
00071  * took 15 seconds and, even worse, the ouput routine doesn't return an error.
00072  * Now the first attempt to send a packet without Ethernet link will wait for
00073  * 5 seconds and subsequent attempts take 0.5 seconds only, always returning
00074  * an error.
00075  *
00076  * Revision 1.11  2005/01/24 21:11:49  freckle
00077  * renamed NutEventPostFromIRQ into NutEventPostFromIrq
00078  *
00079  * Revision 1.10  2005/01/22 19:24:11  haraldkipp
00080  * Changed AVR port configuration names from PORTx to AVRPORTx.
00081  *
00082  * Revision 1.9  2005/01/21 16:49:45  freckle
00083  * Seperated calls to NutEventPostAsync between Threads and IRQs
00084  *
00085  * Revision 1.8  2004/09/22 08:14:48  haraldkipp
00086  * Made configurable
00087  *
00088  * Revision 1.7  2004/03/08 11:14:17  haraldkipp
00089  * Added quick hack for fixed mode.
00090  *
00091  * Revision 1.6  2004/02/25 16:22:33  haraldkipp
00092  * Do not initialize MAC with all zeros
00093  *
00094  * Revision 1.5  2004/01/14 19:31:43  drsung
00095  * Speed improvement to NicWrite applied. Thanks to Kolja Waschk
00096  *
00097  * Revision 1.4  2003/11/06 09:26:50  haraldkipp
00098  * Removed silly line with hardcoded MAC, left over from testing
00099  *
00100  * Revision 1.3  2003/11/04 17:54:47  haraldkipp
00101  * PHY configuration timing changed again for reliable linking
00102  *
00103  * Revision 1.2  2003/11/03 17:12:53  haraldkipp
00104  * Allow linking with RTL8019 driver.
00105  * Links more reliable to 10 MBit networks now.

00162 #define LANC111_RESET_DDR    DDRB
00163 
00164 #elif (LANC111_RESET_AVRPORT == AVRPORTD)

00166 #define LANC111_RESET_DDR    DDRD
00167 
00168 #elif (LANC111_RESET_AVRPORT == AVRPORTE)

00170 #define LANC111_RESET_DDR    DDRE
00171 
00172 #elif (LANC111_RESET_AVRPORT == AVRPORTF)
00173 #define LANC111_RESET_PORT   PORTF

00181  * Determine interrupt settings.
00182  */

00184 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT0
00185 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICRA, ISC00); sbi(EICRA, ISC01)
00186 
00187 #elif (LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ == INT1)
00188 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT1
00189 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICRA, ISC10); sbi(EICRA, ISC11)
00190 
00191 #elif (LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ == INT2)
00192 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT2
00193 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICRA, ISC20); sbi(EICRA, ISC21)
00194 
00195 #elif (LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ == INT3)
00196 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT3
00197 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICRA, ISC30); sbi(EICRA, ISC31)
00198 
00199 #elif (LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ == INT4)
00200 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT4
00201 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICR, ISC40); sbi(EICR, ISC41)
00202 
00203 #elif (LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ == INT6)
00204 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT6
00205 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICR, ISC60); sbi(EICR, ISC61)
00206 
00207 #elif (LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ == INT7)
00208 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT7
00209 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICR, ISC70); sbi(EICR, ISC71)
00210 
00211 #else
00212 #define LANC111_SIGNAL          sig_INTERRUPT5
00213 #define LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE()   sbi(EICR, ISC50); sbi(EICR, ISC51)

00525 #define MSBV(bit)       (1 << ((bit) - 8))
00526 
00527 #define nic_outlb(addr, val) (*(volatile uint8_t *)(addr) = (val))
00528 #define nic_outhb(addr, val) (*(volatile uint8_t *)((addr) + 1) = (val))
00529 #define nic_outwx(addr, val) (*(volatile uint16_t *)(addr) = (val))
00530 #define nic_outw(addr, val) { \
00531     *(volatile uint8_t *)(addr) = (uint8_t)(val); \
00532     *((volatile uint8_t *)(addr) + 1) = (uint8_t)((val) >> 8); \
00533 }
00534 
00535 #define nic_inlb(addr) (*(volatile uint8_t *)(addr))
00536 #define nic_inhb(addr) (*(volatile uint8_t *)((addr) + 1))
00537 #define nic_inw(addr) (*(volatile uint16_t *)(addr))
00538 
00539 #define nic_bs(bank)    nic_outlb(NIC_BSR, bank)
00540 
00545 struct _NICINFO {
00546     HANDLE volatile ni_rx_rdy;  
00547     uint16_t ni_tx_cnt;          
00548     uint32_t ni_rx_packets;       
00549     uint32_t ni_tx_packets;       
00550     uint32_t ni_interrupts;       
00551     uint32_t ni_overruns;         
00552     uint32_t ni_rx_frame_errors;  
00553     uint32_t ni_rx_crc_errors;    
00554     uint32_t ni_rx_missed_errors; 
00555 };
00556 
00560 typedef struct _NICINFO NICINFO;

00570 static HANDLE mutex;
00571 static HANDLE maq;
00572 
00583 static uint8_t NicPhyRegSelect(uint8_t reg, uint8_t we)
00584 {
00585     uint8_t rs;
00586     uint8_t msk;
00587     uint8_t i;
00588 
00589     nic_bs(3);
00590     rs = (nic_inlb(NIC_MGMT) & ~(MGMT_MCLK | MGMT_MDO)) | MGMT_MDOE;
00591 
00592     /* Send idle pattern. */
00593     for (i = 0; i < 33; i++) {
00594         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO);
00595         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO | MGMT_MCLK);
00596     }
00597 
00598     /* Send start sequence. */
00599     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00600     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00601     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO);
00602     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO | MGMT_MCLK);
00603 
00604     /* Write or read mode. */
00605     if (we) {
00606         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00607         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00608         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO);
00609         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO | MGMT_MCLK);
00610     } else {
00611         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO);
00612         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO | MGMT_MCLK);
00613         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00614         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00615     }
00616 
00617     /* Send PHY address. Zero is used for the internal PHY. */
00618     for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
00619         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00620         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00621     }
00622 
00623     /* Send PHY register number. */
00624     for (msk = 0x10; msk; msk >>= 1) {
00625         if (reg & msk) {
00626             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO);
00627             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO | MGMT_MCLK);
00628         } else {
00629             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00630             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00631         }
00632     }
00633     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00634 
00635     return rs;
00636 }
00637 
00647 static uint16_t NicPhyRead(uint8_t reg)
00648 {
00649     uint16_t rc = 0;
00650     uint8_t rs;
00651     uint8_t i;
00652 
00653     /* Select register for reading. */
00654     rs = NicPhyRegSelect(reg, 0);
00655 
00656     /* Switch data direction. */
00657     rs &= ~MGMT_MDOE;
00658     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00659     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00660 
00661     /* Clock data in. */
00662     for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00663         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00664         nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00665         rc <<= 1;
00666         rc |= (nic_inlb(NIC_MGMT) & MGMT_MDI) != 0;
00667     }
00668 
00669     /* This will set the clock line to low. */
00670     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00671 
00672     return rc;
00673 }
00674 
00683 static void NicPhyWrite(uint8_t reg, uint16_t val)
00684 {
00685     uint16_t msk;
00686     uint8_t rs;
00687 
00688     /* Select register for writing. */
00689     rs = NicPhyRegSelect(reg, 1);
00690 
00691     /* Switch data direction dummy. */
00692     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO);
00693     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO | MGMT_MCLK);
00694     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00695     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00696 
00697     /* Clock data out. */
00698     for (msk = 0x8000; msk; msk >>= 1) {
00699         if (val & msk) {
00700             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO);
00701             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MDO | MGMT_MCLK);
00702         } else {
00703             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs);
00704             nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs | MGMT_MCLK);
00705         }
00706     }
00707 
00708     /* Set clock line low and output line int z-state. */
00709     nic_outlb(NIC_MGMT, rs & ~MGMT_MDOE);
00710 }
00711 
00717 static int NicPhyConfig(void)
00718 {
00719     uint16_t phy_sor;
00720     uint16_t phy_sr;
00721     uint16_t phy_to;
00722     uint16_t mode;
00723 
00724     /* 
00725      * Reset the PHY and wait until this self clearing bit
00726      * becomes zero. We sleep 63 ms before each poll and
00727      * give up after 3 retries. 
00728      */
00729     //printf("Reset PHY..");
00730     NicPhyWrite(NIC_PHYCR, PHYCR_RST);
00731     for (phy_to = 0;; phy_to++) {
00732         NutSleep(63);
00733         if ((NicPhyRead(NIC_PHYCR) & PHYCR_RST) == 0)
00734             break;
00735         if (phy_to > 3)
00736             return -1;
00737     }
00738     //printf("OK\n");
00739 
00740     /* Store PHY status output. */
00741     phy_sor = NicPhyRead(NIC_PHYSOR);
00742 
00743     /* Enable PHY interrupts. */
00744     NicPhyWrite(NIC_PHYMSK, PHYMSK_MLOSSSYN | PHYMSK_MCWRD | PHYMSK_MSSD |
00745                 PHYMSK_MESD | PHYMSK_MRPOL | PHYMSK_MJAB | PHYMSK_MSPDDT | PHYMSK_MDPLDT);
00746 
00747     /* Set RPC register. */
00748     mode = RPCR_ANEG | RPCR_LEDA_PAT | RPCR_LEDB_PAT;
00749     nic_bs(0);
00750     nic_outw(NIC_RPCR, mode);
00751 
00752 #ifdef NIC_FIXED
00753     /* Disable link. */
00754     phy_sr = NicPhyRead(NIC_PHYCFR1);
00755     NicPhyWrite(NIC_PHYCFR1, phy_sr | 0x8000);
00756     NutSleep(63);
00757 
00758     /* Set fixed capabilities. */
00759     NicPhyWrite(NIC_PHYCR, NIC_FIXED);
00760     nic_bs(0);
00761     nic_outw(NIC_RPCR, mode);
00762 
00763     /* Enable link. */
00764     phy_sr = NicPhyRead(NIC_PHYCFR1);
00765     NicPhyWrite(NIC_PHYCFR1, phy_sr & ~0x8000);
00766     phy_sr = NicPhyRead(NIC_PHYCFR1);
00767 
00768 #else
00769     /*
00770      * Advertise our capabilities, initiate auto negotiation
00771      * and wait until this has been completed.
00772      */
00773     //printf("Negotiate..");
00774     NicPhyWrite(NIC_PHYANAD, PHYANAD_TX_FDX | PHYANAD_TX_HDX | PHYANAD_10FDX | PHYANAD_10_HDX | PHYANAD_CSMA);
00775     NutSleep(63);
00776     for (phy_to = 0, phy_sr = 0;; phy_to++) {
00777         /* Give up after 10 seconds. */
00778         if (phy_to >= 1024)
00779             return -1;
00780         /* Restart auto negotiation every 4 seconds or on failures. */
00781         if ((phy_to & 127) == 0 /* || (phy_sr & PHYSR_REM_FLT) != 0 */ ) {
00782             NicPhyWrite(NIC_PHYCR, PHYCR_ANEG_EN | PHYCR_ANEG_RST);
00783             //printf("Restart..");
00784             NutSleep(63);
00785         }
00786         /* Check if we are done. */
00787         phy_sr = NicPhyRead(NIC_PHYSR);
00788         //printf("[SR %04X]", phy_sr);
00789         if (phy_sr & PHYSR_ANEG_ACK)
00790             break;
00791         NutSleep(63);
00792     }
00793     //printf("OK\n");
00794 #endif
00795 
00796     return 0;
00797 }
00798 
00809 static INLINE int NicMmuWait(uint16_t tmo)
00810 {
00811     while (tmo--) {
00812         if ((nic_inlb(NIC_MMUCR) & MMUCR_BUSY) == 0)
00813             break;
00814         NutDelay(1);
00815     }
00816     return tmo ? 0 : -1;
00817 }
00818 
00824 static int NicReset(void)
00825 {
00826 #ifdef LANC111_RESET_BIT
00827     sbi(LANC111_RESET_DDR, LANC111_RESET_BIT);
00828     sbi(LANC111_RESET_PORT, LANC111_RESET_BIT);
00829     NutDelay(WAIT100);
00830     cbi(LANC111_RESET_PORT, LANC111_RESET_BIT);
00831     NutDelay(WAIT250);
00832     NutDelay(WAIT250);
00833 #endif
00834 
00835     /* Disable all interrupts. */
00836     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, 0);
00837 
00838     /* MAC and PHY software reset. */
00839     nic_bs(0);
00840     nic_outw(NIC_RCR, RCR_SOFT_RST);
00841 
00842     /* Enable Ethernet protocol handler. */
00843     nic_bs(1);
00844     nic_outw(NIC_CR, CR_EPH_EN);
00845 
00846     NutDelay(10);
00847 
00848     /* Disable transmit and receive. */
00849     nic_bs(0);
00850     nic_outw(NIC_RCR, 0);
00851     nic_outw(NIC_TCR, 0);
00852 
00853     /* Enable auto release. */
00854     nic_bs(1);
00855     nic_outw(NIC_CTR, CTR_AUTO_RELEASE);
00856 
00857     /* Reset MMU. */
00858     nic_bs(2);
00859     nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_RST);
00860     if (NicMmuWait(1000))
00861         return -1;
00862 
00863     return 0;
00864 }
00865 
00866 /*
00867  * Fires up the network interface. NIC interrupts
00868  * should have been disabled when calling this
00869  * function.
00870  *
00871  * \param mac Six byte unique MAC address.
00872  */
00873 static int NicStart(CONST uint8_t * mac)
00874 {
00875     uint8_t i;
00876 
00877     if (NicReset())
00878         return -1;
00879 
00880     /* Enable receiver. */
00881     nic_bs(3);
00882     nic_outlb(NIC_ERCV, 7);
00883     nic_bs(0);
00884     nic_outw(NIC_RCR, RCR_RXEN);
00885 
00886     /* Enable transmitter and padding. */
00887     nic_outw(NIC_TCR, TCR_PAD_EN | TCR_TXENA);
00888 
00889     /* Configure the PHY. */
00890     if (NicPhyConfig())
00891         return -1;
00892 
00893     /* Set MAC address. */
00894     //printf("Set MAC %02X%02X%02X%02X%02X%02X", mac[0], mac[1], mac[2], mac[3], mac[4], mac[5]);
00895     nic_bs(1);
00896     for (i = 0; i < 6; i++)
00897         nic_outlb(NIC_IAR + i, mac[i]);
00898     //printf("OK\n");
00899 
00900     /* Enable interrupts. */
00901     nic_bs(2);
00902     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, INT_ERCV | INT_RCV | INT_RX_OVRN);
00903 
00904     return 0;
00905 }
00906 
00907 /*
00908  * NIC interrupt entry.
00909  */
00910 static void NicInterrupt(void *arg)
00911 {
00912     uint8_t isr;
00913     uint8_t imr;
00914     NICINFO *ni = (NICINFO *) ((NUTDEVICE *) arg)->dev_dcb;
00915 
00916     ni->ni_interrupts++;
00917 
00918     /* Read the interrupt mask and disable all interrupts. */
00919     nic_bs(2);
00920     imr = nic_inlb(NIC_MSK);
00921     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, 0);
00922 
00923     /* Read the interrupt status and acknowledge all interrupts. */
00924     isr = nic_inlb(NIC_IST);
00925     //printf("\n!%02X-%02X ", isr, imr);
00926     isr &= imr;
00927 
00928     /*
00929      * If this is a transmit interrupt, then a packet has been sent. 
00930      * So we can clear the transmitter busy flag and wake up the 
00931      * transmitter thread.
00932      */
00933     if (isr & INT_TX_EMPTY) {
00934         nic_outlb(NIC_ACK, INT_TX_EMPTY);
00935         imr &= ~INT_TX_EMPTY;
00936     }
00937     /* Transmit error. */
00938     else if (isr & INT_TX) {
00939         /* re-enable transmit */
00940         nic_bs(0);
00941         nic_outw(NIC_TCR, nic_inlb(NIC_TCR) | TCR_TXENA);
00942         nic_bs(2);
00943         nic_outlb(NIC_ACK, INT_TX);
00944         /* kill the packet */
00945         nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_PKT);
00946     }
00947 
00948 
00949     /*
00950      * If this is a receive interrupt, then wake up the receiver 
00951      * thread.
00952      */
00953     if (isr & INT_RX_OVRN) {
00954         nic_outlb(NIC_ACK, INT_RX_OVRN);
00955         //nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_TOP);
00956         NutEventPostFromIrq(&ni->ni_rx_rdy);
00957     }
00958     if (isr & INT_ERCV) {
00959         nic_outlb(NIC_ACK, INT_ERCV);
00960         NutEventPostFromIrq(&ni->ni_rx_rdy);
00961     }
00962     if (isr & INT_RCV) {
00963         nic_outlb(NIC_ACK, INT_RCV);
00964         imr &= ~INT_RCV;
00965         NutEventPostFromIrq(&ni->ni_rx_rdy);
00966     }
00967 
00968     if (isr & INT_ALLOC) {
00969         imr &= ~INT_ALLOC;
00970         NutEventPostFromIrq(&maq);
00971     }
00972     //printf(" -%02X-%02X- ", nic_inlb(NIC_IST), inb(PINE) & 0x20);
00973     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, imr);
00974 }
00975 
00976 /*
00977  * Write data block to the NIC.
00978  */
00979 static void NicWrite(uint8_t * buf, uint16_t len)
00980 {
00981     register uint16_t l = len - 1;
00982     register uint8_t ih = (uint16_t) l >> 8;
00983     register uint8_t il = (uint8_t) l;
00984 
00985     if (!len)
00986         return;
00987 
00988     do {
00989         do {
00990             nic_outlb(NIC_DATA, *buf++);
00991         } while (il-- != 0);
00992     } while (ih-- != 0);
00993 }
00994 
00995 /*
00996  * Read data block from the NIC.
00997  */
00998 static void NicRead(uint8_t * buf, uint16_t len)
00999 {
01000     register uint16_t l = len - 1;
01001     register uint8_t ih = (uint16_t) l >> 8;
01002     register uint8_t il = (uint8_t) l;
01003 
01004     if (!len)
01005         return;
01006 
01007     do {
01008         do {
01009             *buf++ = nic_inlb(NIC_DATA);
01010         } while (il-- != 0);
01011     } while (ih-- != 0);
01012 }
01013 
01024 static NETBUF *NicGetPacket(void)
01025 {
01026     NETBUF *nb = 0;
01027     //uint8_t *buf;
01028     uint16_t fsw;
01029     uint16_t fbc;
01030 
01031     /* Check the fifo empty bit. If it is set, then there is 
01032        nothing in the receiver fifo. */
01033     nic_bs(2);
01034     if (nic_inw(NIC_FIFO) & 0x8000) {
01035         return 0;
01036     }
01037 
01038     /* Inialize pointer register. */
01039     nic_outw(NIC_PTR, PTR_READ | PTR_RCV | PTR_AUTO_INCR);
01040     _NOP();
01041     _NOP();
01042     _NOP();
01043     _NOP();
01044 
01045     /* Read status word and byte count. */
01046     fsw = nic_inw(NIC_DATA);
01047     fbc = nic_inw(NIC_DATA);
01048     //printf("[SW=%04X,BC=%04X]", fsw, fbc);
01049 
01050     /* Check for frame errors. */
01051     if (fsw & 0xAC00) {
01052         nb = (NETBUF *) 0xFFFF;
01053     }
01054     /* Check the byte count. */
01055     else if (fbc < 66 || fbc > 1524) {
01056         nb = (NETBUF *) 0xFFFF;
01057     }
01058 
01059     else {
01060         /* 
01061          * Allocate a NETBUF. 
01062          * Hack alert: Rev A chips never set the odd frame indicator.
01063          */
01064         fbc -= 3;
01065         nb = NutNetBufAlloc(0, NBAF_DATALINK, fbc);
01066 
01067         /* Perform the read. */
01068         if (nb)
01069             NicRead(nb->nb_dl.vp, fbc);
01070     }
01071 
01072     /* Release the packet. */
01073     nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_TOP);
01074 
01075     return nb;
01076 }
01077 
01092 static int NicPutPacket(NETBUF * nb)
01093 {
01094     uint16_t sz;
01095     uint8_t odd = 0;
01096     uint8_t imsk;
01097 
01098     //printf("[P]");
01099     /*
01100      * Calculate the number of bytes to be send. Do not send packets 
01101      * larger than the Ethernet maximum transfer unit. The MTU
01102      * consist of 1500 data bytes plus the 14 byte Ethernet header
01103      * plus 4 bytes CRC. We check the data bytes only.
01104      */
01105     if ((sz = nb->nb_nw.sz + nb->nb_tp.sz + nb->nb_ap.sz) > ETHERMTU)
01106         return -1;
01107 
01108     /* Disable all interrupts. */
01109     imsk = nic_inlb(NIC_MSK);
01110     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, 0);
01111 
01112     /* Allocate packet buffer space. */
01113     nic_bs(2);
01114     nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_ALO);
01115     if (NicMmuWait(100))
01116         return -1;
01117 
01118     /* Enable interrupts including allocation success. */
01119     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, imsk | INT_ALLOC);
01120 
01121     /* The MMU needs some time. Use it to calculate the byte count. */
01122     sz += nb->nb_dl.sz;
01123     sz += 6;
01124     if (sz & 1) {
01125         sz++;
01126         odd++;
01127     }
01128 
01129     /* Wait for allocation success. */
01130     while ((nic_inlb(NIC_IST) & INT_ALLOC) == 0) {
01131         if (NutEventWait(&maq, 125)) {
01132             nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_RST);
01133             NicMmuWait(1000);
01134             nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_ALO);
01135             if (NicMmuWait(100) || (nic_inlb(NIC_IST) & INT_ALLOC) == 0) {
01136                 if (NutEventWait(&maq, 125)) {
01137                     return -1;
01138                 }
01139             }
01140         }
01141     }
01142 
01143     /* Disable interrupts. */
01144     imsk = nic_inlb(NIC_MSK);
01145     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, 0);
01146 
01147 
01148     nic_outlb(NIC_PNR, nic_inhb(NIC_PNR));
01149 
01150     nic_outw(NIC_PTR, 0x4000);
01151 
01152     /* Transfer control word. */
01153     nic_outlb(NIC_DATA, 0);
01154     nic_outlb(NIC_DATA, 0);
01155 
01156     /* Transfer the byte count. */
01157     nic_outw(NIC_DATA, sz);
01158 
01159     /* Transfer the Ethernet frame. */
01160     NicWrite(nb->nb_dl.vp, nb->nb_dl.sz);
01161     NicWrite(nb->nb_nw.vp, nb->nb_nw.sz);
01162     NicWrite(nb->nb_tp.vp, nb->nb_tp.sz);
01163     NicWrite(nb->nb_ap.vp, nb->nb_ap.sz);
01164 
01165     if (odd)
01166         nic_outlb(NIC_DATA, 0);
01167 
01168     /* Transfer the control word. */
01169     nic_outw(NIC_DATA, 0);
01170 
01171     /* Enqueue packet. */
01172     if (NicMmuWait(100))
01173         return -1;
01174     nic_outlb(NIC_MMUCR, MMU_ENQ);
01175 
01176     /* Enable interrupts. */
01177     imsk |= INT_TX | INT_TX_EMPTY;
01178     nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, imsk);
01179 
01180     return 0;
01181 }
01182 
01183 
01188 THREAD(NicRxLanc, arg)
01189 {
01190     NUTDEVICE *dev;
01191     IFNET *ifn;
01192     NICINFO *ni;
01193     NETBUF *nb;
01194     uint8_t imsk;
01195 
01196     dev = arg;
01197     ifn = (IFNET *) dev->dev_icb;
01198     ni = (NICINFO *) dev->dev_dcb;
01199 
01200     /*
01201      * This is a temporary hack. Due to a change in initialization,
01202      * we may not have got a MAC address yet. Wait until one has been
01203      * set.
01204      */
01205     for (;;) {
01206         if (*((uint32_t *) (ifn->if_mac)) && *((uint32_t *) (ifn->if_mac)) != 0xFFFFFFFFUL) {
01207             break;
01208         }
01209         NutSleep(63);
01210     }
01211 
01212     /*
01213      * Do not continue unless we managed to start the NIC. We are
01214      * trapped here if the Ethernet link cannot be established.
01215      * This happens, for example, if no Ethernet cable is plugged
01216      * in.
01217      */
01218     while(NicStart(ifn->if_mac)) {
01219         NutSleep(1000);
01220     }
01221 
01222     LANC111_SIGNAL_MODE();
01223     sbi(EIMSK, LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ);
01224 
01225     NutEventPost(&mutex);
01226 
01227     /* Run at high priority. */
01228     NutThreadSetPriority(9);
01229 
01230     for (;;) {
01231 
01232         /*
01233          * Wait for the arrival of new packets or
01234          * check the receiver every two second.
01235          */
01236         NutEventWait(&ni->ni_rx_rdy, 2000);
01237 
01238         /*
01239          * Fetch all packets from the NIC's internal
01240          * buffer and pass them to the registered handler.
01241          */
01242         imsk = nic_inlb(NIC_MSK);
01243         nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, 0);
01244         while ((nb = NicGetPacket()) != 0) {
01245             if (nb != (NETBUF *) 0xFFFF) {
01246                 ni->ni_rx_packets++;
01247                 (*ifn->if_recv) (dev, nb);
01248             }
01249         }
01250         nic_outlb(NIC_MSK, imsk | INT_RCV | INT_ERCV);
01251     }
01252 }
01253 
01264 int LancOutput(NUTDEVICE * dev, NETBUF * nb)
01265 {
01266     static uint32_t mx_wait = 5000;
01267     int rc = -1;
01268     NICINFO *ni;
01269 
01270     /*
01271      * After initialization we are waiting for a long time to give
01272      * the PHY a chance to establish an Ethernet link.
01273      */
01274     if (NutEventWait(&mutex, mx_wait) == 0) {
01275         ni = (NICINFO *) dev->dev_dcb;
01276 
01277         if (NicPutPacket(nb) == 0) {
01278             ni->ni_tx_packets++;
01279             rc = 0;
01280             /* Ethernet works. Set a long waiting time in case we
01281                temporarly lose the link next time. */
01282             mx_wait = 5000;
01283         }
01284         NutEventPost(&mutex);
01285     }
01286     /*
01287      * Probably no Ethernet link. Significantly reduce the waiting
01288      * time, so following transmission will soon return an error.
01289      */
01290     else {
01291         mx_wait = 500;
01292     }
01293     return rc;
01294 }
01295 
01313 int LancInit(NUTDEVICE * dev)
01314 {
01315     /* Disable NIC interrupt and clear NICINFO structure. */
01316     cbi(EIMSK, LANC111_SIGNAL_IRQ);
01317     memset(dev->dev_dcb, 0, sizeof(NICINFO));
01318 
01319     /* Register interrupt handler and enable interrupts. */
01320     if (NutRegisterIrqHandler(&LANC111_SIGNAL, NicInterrupt, dev))
01321         return -1;
01322 
01323     /*
01324      * Start the receiver thread.
01325      *
01326      * avr-gcc size optimized code used 76 bytes.
01327      */
01328     NutThreadCreate("rxi5", NicRxLanc, dev, (NUT_THREAD_LANCRXSTACK * NUT_THREAD_STACK_MULT) + NUT_THREAD_STACK_ADD);
01329 
01330     //NutSleep(500);
01331 
01332     return 0;
01333 }

01335 static NICINFO dcb_eth0;
01336 
01342 static IFNET ifn_eth0 = {
01343     IFT_ETHER,                  
01344     0,                          
01345     {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},         
01346     0,                          
01347     0,                          
01348     0,                          
01349     ETHERMTU,                   
01350     0,                          
01351     0,                          
01352     0,                          
01353     NutEtherInput,              
01354     LancOutput,                 
01355     NutEtherOutput              
01356 };

01367 NUTDEVICE devSmsc111 = {
01368     0,                          /* Pointer to next device. */
01369     {'e', 't', 'h', '0', 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},        /* Unique device name. */
01370     IFTYP_NET,                  /* Type of device. */
01371     0,                          /* Base address. */
01372     0,                          /* First interrupt number. */
01373     &ifn_eth0,                  /* Interface control block. */
01374     &dcb_eth0,                  /* Driver control block. */
01375     LancInit,                   /* Driver initialization routine. */
01376     0,                          /* Driver specific control function. */
01377     0,                          /* Read from device. */
01378     0,                          /* Write to device. */
01379     0,                          /* Write from program space data to device. */
01380     0,                          /* Open a device or file. */
01381     0,                          /* Close a device or file. */
01382     0                           /* Request file size. */
01383 };
